pageContext.collection: Thomas Howlett, 17 Pear Tree Walk, Cheshunt, Herts. (December 1962),To be lent to: J. Edwards, Librarian of Cheshunt Council,Then to go to museum of: St. Albans Sand and Gravel Co., Ltd., Riverside, London Colney, St. Albans, Herts.
pageContext.site: England,Essex,Waltham Abbey,In ballast stated to have been dug from Waltham Marsh, about 150 yards south of Powdermill Cut stream, close to fence of Gunpowder Factory.
pageContext.remarks: Bronze leaf-shaped sword and iron spear-head in possession of Vicar of Waltham Abbey Church (Dec. 1962) stated to have been found near this spear-head.
